```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}

#make plot
ggplot() +   
 
   theme_void() +   #gives your map a blank background
  
#summarize data, specify aestetics. x and y are probably going to be lat/long. z is whatever variable you want summarized. binwidth is how big you want the data aggregation
  stat_summary_hex(data=data, aes(y=START_LAT, x=START_LON, z = HAIL_AMOUNT_LB),binwidth = c(0.16666,0.16666),alpha=1) + 
  
 
  geom_polygon(data = NEUS, aes(x=long, y = lat, group = group), fill = "darkgreen",  color="black",inherit.aes = FALSE)  +
  ggtitle("Where are plaice caught? Study Fleet 2010-2020") +
  scale_fill_viridis(
      trans = "log",
      breaks = c(1, 10, 100, 1000),
      name = "Catch (lbs)" ) +
  geom_sf(data = areas, color = "black", size = 0.5, alpha =0) +
  coord_sf(ylim = c(40, 44),  xlim = c(-74, -67))
```
